    "patch": "@@ -83,7 +83,7 @@ In this step, you create a security profile to group filtering policies like web\n Since threat intelligence is critical for users' basic security posture, you can alternatively link your threat intelligence policy to the baseline security profile, which applies policy to all users' traffic in your tenant.\n \n > [!NOTE]\n-> You can only configure threat intelligence policy per security profile. Rule priorities within each security control handle exceptions, and security controls follow the ordering, (1) TLS inspection > (2) Web content filtering > (3) Threat intelligence > (4) File type > (6) Data loss prevention > (7) Third-party\n+> You can only configure threat intelligence policy per security profile. Rule priorities within each security control handle exceptions, and security controls follow the ordering, (1) TLS inspection > (2) Web content filtering > (3) Threat intelligence > (4) File type > (5) Data loss prevention > (6) Third-party\n \n 1. Browse to **Global Secure Access** > **Secure** > **Security profiles**.\n 2. Select **Create profile**."

    "patch": "@@ -5,14 +5,14 @@ author: omondiatieno\n manager: mwongerapk\n ms.service: entra-id\n ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 09/22/2025\n+ms.date: 09/23/2025\n ms.subservice: hybrid-cloud-sync\n ms.author: jomondi\n ms.custom: include file, sfi-image-nochange\n ---\n \n-1. In the Azure portal, select **Microsoft Entra ID**.\n-1. On the left pane, select **Microsoft Entra Connect**, and then select **Cloud Sync**.\n+1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as at least a [Hybrid Identity Administrator](~/identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#hybrid-identity-administrator).\n+1. On the left pane, select **Entra Connect**, and then select **Cloud Sync**.\n \n    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/new-ux-1.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows the Get started screen.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/new-ux-1.png\":::\n "

    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 9,

    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/a482e630f00e72f67067c78b42a9adeb34c50af4/docs%2Fincludes%2Fentra-cloud-sync-how-to-verify-installation.md",

    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fentra-cloud-sync-how-to-verify-installation.md?ref=a482e630f00e72f67067c78b42a9adeb34c50af4",
    "patch": "@@ -2,12 +2,13 @@\n title: Include file\n description: Include file\n \n-author: billmath\n+author: omondiatieno\n+manager: mwongerapk\n ms.service: entra-id\n ms.topic: include\n-ms.date: 11/11/2022\n-ms.author: billmath\n-ms.custom: include file\n+ms.date: 09/23/2025\n+ms.subservice: hybrid-cloud-sync\n+ms.author: jomondi\n ---\n \n Agent verification occurs in the Azure portal and on the local server that runs the agent.\n@@ -16,21 +17,20 @@ Agent verification occurs in the Azure portal and on the local server that runs\n \n To verify that Microsoft Entra ID registers the agent, follow these steps:\n \n-1. Sign in to the [Azure portal](https://portal.azure.com).\n-1. Select **Microsoft Entra ID**.\n-1. Select **Microsoft Entra Connect**, and then select **Cloud Sync**.\n+1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as at least a [Hybrid Identity Administrator](~/identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#hybrid-identity-administrator).\n+1. Select **Entra Connect**, and then select **Cloud Sync**.\n \n     :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/new-ux-1.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot that shows the Get started screen.\" lightbox=\"media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-install/new-ux-1.png\":::\n \n-1. On the **Cloud Sync** page, you see the agents that you installed. Verify that the agent appears and that the status is **healthy**.\n+1. On the **Cloud Sync** page, click **Agents** to see the agents that you installed. Verify that the agent appears and that the status is **active**.\n \n ### Verify the agent on the local server\n \n To verify that the agent is running, follow these steps:\n \n 1. Sign in to the server with an administrator account.\n 1. Go to **Services**. You can also use *Start/Run/Services.msc* to get to it.\n-1. Under **Services**, make sure that **Microsoft Entra Connect Agent Updater** and **Microsoft Entra Connect Provisioning Agent** are present and that the status is **Running**.\n+1. Under **Services**, make sure that **Microsoft Azure AD Connect Agent Updater** and **Microsoft Azure AD Connect Provisioning Agent** are present and that the status is **Running**.\n \n     [![Screenshot that shows the Windows services.](./media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-verify-installation/windows-services.png)](./media/entra-cloud-sync-how-to-verify-installation/windows-services.png#lightbox)\n "

The configuration status should now be **Healthy**.\n+ 3. Select **New configuration** > **AD to Microsoft Entra ID sync**.\n+ 4. Choose the domain that you want to sync, and select **Create**.\n \n-For more information on configuring Microsoft Entra Cloud Sync, see [Provision Active Directory to Microsoft Entra ID](/entra/identity/hybrid/cloud-sync/how-to-configure).\n+For more information about how to configure Microsoft Entra Cloud Sync, see [Provision Active Directory to Microsoft Entra ID](/entra/identity/hybrid/cloud-sync/how-to-configure).\n \n ## Verify users are created and synchronization is occurring\n \n@@ -68,7 +68,7 @@ You'll now verify that the users that you had in your on-premises directory that\n \n  1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as at least a [Hybrid Identity Administrator](~/identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#hybrid-identity-administrator).\n  2. Browse to **Entra ID** > **Users**.\n- 3. Verify that you see the new users in our tenant\n+ 3. Verify that you see the new users in your tenant\n \n ## Test signing in with one of your users\n "

ai_summary.Response: This commit makes several documentation updates. Primarily, it refines the ordering of security controls within the Global Secure Access documentation and updates the navigation paths and image references for Microsoft Entra Connect Cloud Sync, including a new image for the cloud sync configurations. Additionally, it clarifies instructions for downloading authentication scripts and updates author and date metadata across several include files.
